newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer details mid-term ROE goals.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer details mid-term ROE goals.

text.p: Sulzer AG said it expected to achieve a return on equity of 14 percent for its industrial business and 17 percent in its medical technology operations in three to four years.

Chief executive Fritz Fahrni told a news conference the return on equity (ROE) goal of 14 percent was a collective total for the four industrial divisions, Sulzer Roteq, Sulzer Winterthur, Sulzer Rueti and Sulzer Infra.
Fahrni set the ROE goal of 17 percent for Sulzer Medica, which will be spun off as a separately listed public company later this year. Sulzer will still hold a majority.
"We have set these goals as a threshhold to be reached in the next three to four years," Fahrni told the annual news conference.
